Sr Experience Researcher, Creative Cloud Services

at Adobe in San Francisco, CA from 2/21/2021

On the Design Research & Strategy team, our mission is to lay a user-centered and data-driven foundation for Adobe product design and development. We are seeking a Senior Experience Researcher to steer product research from early strategic explorations through to shipping product.

Responsibilities

Assess a project’s scope, determine appropriate research questions, and identify appropriate research methods (developing new methods to meet needs).
Run research studies from start to finish, including; developing a realistic research plan and materials, recruiting participants, and synthesizing data into findings.
Advocate for the customer by articulating research findings and product ideas through clear and insightful presentations.
Engage with different roles across the product team to understand and influence business goals, system architecture, and product designs.
Mentor junior staff and oversee contractors/vendors on more complex programs of study.
Present work in group-wide or company-wide forums (e.g., brown bags, tech summit, MAX, KTB, etc.).

Minimum Qualifications

Significant hands-on research experience, with at least some of that experience in an industry setting (e.g. UX/product research, market research, consulting, etc.)
An undergraduate degree from a 4-year, accredited institution.
Able to handle areas (user/product/domain) that may be ambiguous or ill-defined.
Proven ability to use multiple research methods and are able to explain the rationale for using each one.
Awareness of UX industry trends, incorporating new research techniques when appropriate.
Strong organizational, planning, and time management skills.
An understanding of the product life cycle and can time research to have maximum impact.
Can collaborate effectively across all project roles (design, research, product management, engineering, etc
Don’t just summarize study data, but go one step further to identify meaningful user needs and/or product issues.
Can proactively identify and communicate clear product solutions based on these findings, sometimes across organizational departments.
Ability to clearly articulate ideas, sometimes in various ways to meet the needs of different recipients (written reports, user profiles, scenarios, etc.).
Experience presenting work at the management, director, and VP levels.

Preferred Qualifications

An advanced degree in psychology, anthropology, data science, or a related field.
Familiarity with or interest in Adobe’s creative (Photoshop, InDesign, Illustrator), document (Acrobat, PDF), and/or Experience (Analytics, AEM, etc,) tools.
